message.entry: The following elements of bus object ''{0}'' are configured with unbounded dimensions and ''Fixed'' DimensionsMode. Update these elements to ''Variable'' DimensionsMode:
Element ''{0}''\t: (DimensionsMode: 'Fixed', Dimensions: {1})

<sldiag objui="inport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">Input port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> in block ''{1}'' must have discrete sample time when it is an unbounded array signal or a bus signal that contains unbounded array elements.
Invalid use of S-Function API ''{1}''.\n\nData type in model ''{0}'' is invalid. It must be an unbounded signal or a bus signal that contains unbounded array elements.
Invalid use of S-Function API ''{2}''.\n\nThe input port index {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of ''{1}'' is out of range [0...{3,number,integer}] for the current model.
Invalid use of S-Function API ''{2}''.\n\nThe output port index {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of ''{1}'' is out of range [0...{3,number,integer}] for the current model.

Invalid use of S-Function API ''{1}''.\n\nData type in model ''{0}'' is invalid. Use of API is only valid if the input data type maps to a Simulink.Bus object with one or more unbounded variable-size Simulink.BusElement-s.

Invalid use of S-Function API ''{2}''.\n\n<sldiag objui="inport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">Input port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of ''{1}'' must be an unbounded signal or a bus signal that contains unbounded array elements.

Invalid use of S-Function API ''{2}''.\n\n<sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">Output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of ''{1}'' must be an unbounded signal or a bus signal that contains unbounded array elements.

<sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">Output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> in block ''{1}'' must have discrete sample time when it is an unbounded array signal or a bus signal whose elements are unbounded.

Frame-based signals are not supported at <sldiag objui="inport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">input port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> in block ''{1}'' when it is an unbounded array signal or a bus signal whose elements are unbounded.

Frame-based signals are not supported at <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> in block ''{1}'' when it is an unbounded array signal or a bus signal that contains unbounded array elements.
Input port {0,number,integer} of ''{1}'' is configured to process an unbounded array and therefore cannot accept symbolic dimension specification.
Output port {0,number,integer} of ''{1}'' is configured to process an unbounded array and therefore cannot accept symbolic dimension specification.

The <sldiag objui="inport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">input port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of ''{1}'' is set to accept unbounded array signals, but the port is using discontiguous memory. If you are using an S-function, consider setting ''ssSetInputPortRequiredContiguous'' to on. Otherwise, consider inserting a Signal Conversion block upstream of this input port.
The value {1,number,integer} of dimension {0, number, integer} is outside the valid range [0 to {2,number,integer}]
The element size of the contained data type cannot be changed from {0,number,integer} to {1,number,integer}.
The specified number of dimensions cannot be changed from {0,number,integer} to {1,number,integer}.
Dimension {0,number,integer} has width {1,number,integer}, which is out of range: 0 to {2,number,integer}.
Runtime width of an unbounded array must be in the range: 0 to {0,number,integer}.
The specified dimension index {0,number,integer} must be in the range of 0 to {1,number,integer} because the total number of dimensions of the unbounded array signal is {2,number,integer}.
Simulink cannot set the current dimensions for <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of ''{1}''.

Invalid initial output detected for ''{0}'': The dimensions specification for initial output must match the dimensionality of the output signal, because the output signal is an unbounded array or a bus containing unbounded array elements.

Invalid initial output detected for ''{0}'': Output signal cannot be initialized using a non-empty initial output, because the output signal is a bus containing unbounded array elements or an unbounded array of buses.

Invalid initial output detected for ''{0}'': The data type of initial output of must match the data type of the output signal, because the output signal is an unbounded array or a bus containing unbounded array elements.

Invalid initial output detected for ''{0}'': The complexity of initial output must match the complexity of the output signal, because the output signal is an unbounded array or a bus containing unbounded array elements.
Use of unbounded variable-size signals with fixed-dimensions mode signals is not supported. Following is the list of ports that need to be updated: {0}
<sldiag objui="inport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">input port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of block ''{1}''.
<sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of block ''{1}''.

Model ''{0}'' is using Simulink.Bus objects with bounded variable-size elements. Because the model also makes use of unbounded variable-size signals, we recommend updating the elements of these bus objects to have unbounded variable-size specification: {1}

Model ''{0}'' is using bounded variable-size arrays of buses. Because the model also makes use of unbounded variable-size signals, we recommend updating the following ports to use unbounded variable-size specification:
<sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of block ''{1}''.
Linearization of model ''{0}'' is currently not supported because of the usage of unbounded variable-size signals.
Use of unbounded variable-size signals in model ''{0}'' is not supported for accelerator mode simulation.

Logging Outport ''{0}'' with unbounded signals is not supported when ''Format'' is set to ''Array'' or ''Structure''. To log such Outports, set ''Format'' to ''Dataset'' on the Data Import/Export pane. You can disable root-level Outport logging by clearing the ''Output'' checkbox on the Data Import/Export pane.
Saving model operating point for ''{0}'' is currently not supported because of the use of unbounded variable-size signals {1}.
Invalid setting for the number of dimensions ({0,number,integer}) of unbounded array signal. The specified number of dimensions must be between {1,number,integer} to {2,number,integer}.
Dimension ''Inf'' is not supported in code generation when target language is C. Switch target language to C++.
Observing or connecting a signal viewer to a unbounded variable-size signal is not supported. Following is the list of ports that need to be updated: {0}
<sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> in block ''{1}''.

<sldiag objui="inport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">Input port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of MATLAB System block ''{1}'' is configured to process an unbounded array, while the block is configured to simulate through code generation. Code generation for unbounded array is not supported when target language is set to C. Switch model simulation target language to C++, or alternatively, set block parameter ''Simulate using'' to ''Interpreted execution''. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="suggestion"> <cmd>configset.highlightParameter(bdroot(''{1}''),''SimTargetLang'');</cmd> <txt>Choose ''C++'' as the language for simulation target</txt> </action> <action type="fixit" btn="apply" id="DisableCodeGen"> <cmd>set_param(''{1}'', ''SimulateUsing'', ''Interpreted execution'');</cmd> <txt>Simulate using interpreted execution</txt> </action> </actions>

<sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">Output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of MATLAB System block ''{1}'' is configured to process an unbounded array, while the block is configured to simulate through code generation. Code generation for unbounded array is not supported when target language is set to C. Switch model simulation target language to C++, or alternatively, set block parameter ''Simulate using'' to ''Interpreted execution''. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="suggestion"> <cmd>configset.highlightParameter(bdroot(''{1}''),''SimTargetLang'');</cmd> <txt>Choose ''C++''as the language for simulation target</txt> </action> <action type="fixit" btn="apply" id="DisableCodeGen"> <cmd>set_param(''{1}'', ''SimulateUsing'', ''Interpreted execution'');</cmd> <txt>Simulate using interpreted execution</txt> </action> </actions>

Unable to generate code for MATLAB System block ''{1}'' because <sldiag objui="inport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">input port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of the block is configured for unbounded variable-size signal and code generation for MATLAB System block is not supported for unbounded variable-size signals.

Unable to generate code for MATLAB System block ''{1}'' because <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of the block is configured for unbounded variable-size signal and code generation for MATLAB System block is not supported for unbounded variable-size signals.
Dimension ''Inf'' is not supported in Simulink Real Time.
Dimension ''Inf'' is not supported in rapid accelerator mode.
Dimension ''Inf'' is not supported in external mode.
Dimension ''Inf'' is not supported for RTW S-Fcn target
Dimension ''Inf'' is not supported for GPU Coder
Dimension ''Inf'' is not supported when dynamic memory allocation function is being used. Consider turning off ''Use dynamic memory allocation for model initialization'' in Code Generation Interface.
Error in port widths. <sldiag objui="inport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">Input port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of ''{1}'' is an unbounded one-dimensional signal.
Error in port widths. <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">Output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of ''{1}'' is an unbounded one-dimensional signal.
Allocation for unbounded variable-size signal aborted.

Referenced model ''{0}'' contains unbounded variable-size signals and therefore requires setting ''Propagate sizes of variable-size signals'' to ''During execution''. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>configset.internal.fixIt(''{0}'',''PropagateVarSize'',''During execution'')</cmd> <txt>Change <sldiag objui="configset" objparam="PropagateVarSize">Propagate sizes of variable-size signals</sldiag> to ''During execution''</txt> </action> </actions>

Model ''{0}'' contains unbounded variable-size signals and therefore requires setting the configuration parameter ''Underspecified initialization detection'' to ''Simplified''. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>configset.internal.fixIt(''{0}'',''UnderspecifiedInitializationDetection'',''Simplified'')</cmd> <txt>Change <sldiag objui="configset" objparam="UnderspecifiedInitializationDetection">Underspecified initialization detection</sldiag> to ''Simplified''</txt> </action> </actions>

Function-call (SS_FCN_CALL) data type for S-Function block ''{1}'' <sldiag objui="inport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}"> input port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> is not supported when the input port is configured to accept unbounded variable-size signals.

Function-call (SS_FCN_CALL) data type for S-Function block ''{1}'' <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}"> output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> is not supported when the output port is configured to output unbounded variable-size signals.

Signal viewer connected to <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of block ''{1}'' does not support visualization of unbounded variable-size signals.
Simulink does not support the unbounded variable-size signal at output {2,number,integer} of block ''{3}'' inside subsystem ''{0}'' because the subsystem contains a For Each block (''{1}'').

The variable-size signal at the <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag> of block ''{1}'' is unbounded. After partitioning, For Each subsystem block input signal must be fixed-size or variable-size with finite dimensions.
The signal at input {0,number,integer} of subsystem ''{1}'' is unbounded, which is not supported because the subsystem contains a For Each block (''{2}'').
Test harnesses are currently unsupported for components-under-test that use unbounded variable-size signals on their interfaces.

Model does not support generating std::vector containers to represent 1-D dynamic arrays because ''{0}'' uses the method ''{1}''. Either remove the method call or set 'Dynamic array container type' to 'coder::array'.
Constant block ''{1}'' does not support bus with unbounded variable-size elements at <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0,number,integer}" objname="{1}">output port {0,number,integer}</sldiag>.
